pageContext.claim: “In Arizona alone, last year, ICE officers arrested over 4,500 criminal aliens charged or convicted of dangerous offenses, including robbery, rape and murder. Right here in Phoenix, an illegal alien chased a man through a parking lot and shot him in cold blood then walked over to the victim and shot him four more times right in the face as he lay dying in the street.”
pageContext.analysis: Immigration and Customs Enforcement reported more than 4,000 administrative arrests in Phoenix in Fiscal 2019 of people who either were convicted criminals or had criminal charges pending. It did not, however, breakdown what criminal charges are counted, as the official list can range from homicide to traffic offenses. In other words, not all of those arrests were of people charged with or convicted of murder, robbery or rape.
